content.raw:
A couple of other things that would be nice to clarify:

* What happens when an accessor function name conflicts with class name?, e.g. `Model()` conflicts with class `Model`. We've been renaming them to `ModelByName(const std::string &)`and `ModelById(const unsigned int)`. However, I've seen places that just use overloaded functions when the accessor function doesn't conflict with a class name.

* We also have APIs that use `Query` instead of `Get` (see discussion in [this pull request](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/73/slimmed-down-the-plugin-pull-request-no/activity)), mainly because the function name happens to be both a noun and a verb. Should there be rules for this?
content.html:
A couple of other things that would be nice to clarify:

  • What happens when an accessor function name conflicts with class name?, e.g. Model() conflicts with class Model. We've been renaming them to ModelByName(const std::string &)and ModelById(const unsigned int). However, I've seen places that just use overloaded functions when the accessor function doesn't conflict with a class name.

  • We also have APIs that use Query instead of Get (see discussion in this pull request), mainly because the function name happens to be both a noun and a verb. Should there be rules for this?
